intro: Pedicularis ganpinensis, commonly known as the Ganpin's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a distinctive hooded structure. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
